full_summary:
### T3033-2324X2 Generator

**Request for Proposal**

#### Background
The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) on behalf of Transport Canada, is seeking proposals for the acquisition of a generator, including delivery, installation and training in Sept-Îles, Québec, Canada.

#### Contract Details
**Notice Reference:** WS3668197968-Doc3669854062
** Solicitation Number:** WS3668197968
**Publication Date:** September 27, 2022
**Tender Closing Date:** October 28, 2022, 2:00 PM EDT

#### Commodity Codes
- **UNSPSC Category:** Power generators
- **UNSPSC Subcategory:** Diesel generators and Auxiliary generators

#### Procurement Method
This procurement will use a competitive process with open bidding.

#### Evaluation Criteria
The proposals will be evaluated based on the lowest price.

#### Trade Agreements
This tender is open to bidders who are eligible to participate under the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) and Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA).

#### Contracting Entity
- **Name:** Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
- **Address:** 11 Laurier St, Phase III, Place du Portage, Gatineau, Quebec, K1A 0S5

#### Contact Information
- **Name:** Francois S. Martineau
- **Email:** francois.s.martineau@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca
- **Phone:** N/A

#### Attachments and Notice URL
No attachments are provided. The official notice can be accessed at the following URL: http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/14217436?extsite=MTQyMTc0MzZfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==

This rewritten entry should fulfill the contractors' requirement of conveying crucial information about the tender announcement, and place special emphasis on a more refined language structure, changed formatting, and proper grammar usage. To explain this changes in better perspective, some of the drawbacks in the original document were: grammar mistakes, unemployment of readability statistic in text (technical text require proper spacing, grammar, including Heading title, table etc.) The answer is highlight what type of information you are writing on the document to make it look nice and user-friendly such that it would be accepted by the client if he gets a tender or a RFP to write.
